docsTags.name: virtualProp
docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: label - The label text to associate with the select. Use the `labelPlacement` property to control where the label is placed relative to the select. Use this if you need to render a label with custom HTML.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: placeholder - The text displayed in the select when there is no value.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: text - The displayed value of the select.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: container - The container for the selected text or placeholder.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: label - The label text describing the select.

props.name: cancelText
props.docs: The text to display on the cancel button.

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

This property is only available when using the modern select syntax.

props.name: compareWith
props.type: ((currentValue: any, compareValue: any) => boolean) | null | string | undefined

complexType.resolved: ((currentValue: any, compareValue: any) => boolean) | null | string | undefined

props.docs: A property name or function used to compare object values

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the select.

props.name: expandedIcon
props.docs:
The toggle icon to show when the select is open. If defined, the icon
rotation behavior in `md` mode will be disabled. If undefined, `toggleIcon`
will be used for when the select is both open and closed.

props.name: fill
props.docs:
The fill for the item. If `"solid"` the item will have a background. If
`"outline"` the item will be transparent with a border. Only available in `md` mode.

props.name: interface
props.docs: The interface the select should use: `action-sheet`, `popover` or `alert`.

props.name: interfaceOptions
props.docs:
Any additional options that the `alert`, `action-sheet` or `popover` interface
can take. See the [ion-alert docs](./alert), the
[ion-action-sheet docs](./action-sheet) and the
[ion-popover docs](./popover) for the
create options for each interface.

Note: `interfaceOptions` will not override `inputs` or `buttons` with the `alert` interface.

props.name: justify
props.docs:
How to pack the label and select within a line.
`justify` does not apply when the label and select
are on different lines when `labelPlacement` is set to
`"floating"` or `"stacked"`.
`"start"`: The label and select will appear on the left in LTR and
on the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label and select will appear on the right in LTR and
on the left in RTL.
`"space-between"`: The label and select will appear on opposite
ends of the line with space between the two elements.

props.name: label
props.docs:
The visible label associated with the select.

Use this if you need to render a plaintext label.

The `label` property will take priority over the `label` slot if both are used.

props.name: labelPlacement
props.docs:
Where to place the label relative to the select.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the select in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the select in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"floating"`: The label will appear smaller and above the select when the select is focused or it has a value. Otherwise it will appear on top of the select.
`"stacked"`: The label will appear smaller and above the select regardless even when the select is blurred or has no value.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").
When using `"floating"` or `"stacked"` we recommend initializing the select with either a `value` or a `placeholder`.

props.name: legacy
props.docs:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt components in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or the `label` property. As a result,
the `legacy` property should only be used as an escape hatch when you want to
avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.
Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: multiple
props.docs: If `true`, the select can accept multiple values.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: okText
props.docs: The text to display on the ok button.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: The text to display when the select is empty.

props.name: selectedText
props.docs: The text to display instead of the selected option's value.

props.name: shape
props.docs: The shape of the select. If "round" it will have an increased border radius.

props.name: toggleIcon
props.docs:
The toggle icon to use. Defaults to `chevronExpand` for `ios` mode,
or `caretDownSharp` for `md` mode.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the select.

methods.name: open

tags.name: param
tags.text: event The user interface event that called the open.

parameters.text: The user interface event that called the open.

methods.docs:
Open the select overlay. The overlay is either an alert, action sheet, or popover,
depending on the `interface` property on the `ion-select`.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: event The user interface event that called the open.

events.docs: Emitted when the select loses focus.
Emitted when the selection is cancelled.
Emitted when the value has changed.
Emitted when the overlay is dismissed.
Emitted when the select has focus.

styles.name: --border-radius
styles.docs: Radius of the select border. A large radius may display unevenly when using fill="outline"; if needed, use shape="round" instead or increase --padding-start.

styles.name: --highlight-color-focused
styles.docs: The color of the highlight on the select when focused

styles.name: --highlight-color-invalid
styles.docs: The color of the highlight on the select when invalid

styles.name: --highlight-color-valid
styles.docs: The color of the highlight on the select when valid

styles.name: --padding-end
styles.docs: Right padding if direction is left-to-right, and left padding if direction is right-to-left of the select

styles.name: --padding-start
styles.docs: Left padding if direction is left-to-right, and right padding if direction is right-to-left of the select

styles.name: --placeholder-color
styles.docs: Color of the select placeholder text

styles.name: --placeholder-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the select placeholder text

styles.name: --ripple-color
styles.docs: The color of the ripple effect on MD mode.

slots.name: label
slots.docs: The label text to associate with the select. Use the `labelPlacement` property to control where the label is placed relative to the select. Use this if you need to render a label with custom HTML.

parts.name: container
parts.docs: The container for the selected text or placeholder.

parts.name: label
parts.docs: The label text describing the select.

parts.name: placeholder
parts.docs: The text displayed in the select when there is no value.

parts.name: text
parts.docs: The displayed value of the select.
